questions.question: An electric hoist uses 18,000 J of electrical energy to lift a 240 kg payload to a vertical height of 6.0 m. Calculate the efficiency of the hoist as a percentage. (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)
A diesel engine has an efficiency of 34%. If the engine consumes fuel containing 450 MJ of chemical energy, how much energy is dissipated to the environment as wasted heat?
A heavy-duty water pump is rated at 4.5 kW. While operating, it successfully delivers 3.8 kW of useful mechanical power to the water flow. What is the efficiency of this pump?
A conveyor belt system is 65% efficient. If the system must perform 13,000 J of useful work to move a series of packages, how much total electrical energy must be supplied to the motor?

A remote sensor is powered by a system with three stages: Solar panel efficiency: 18%, Battery storage efficiency: 85%, Voltage regulator efficiency: 92%. Calculate the overall efficiency of the system from sunlight to final power output.

An incandescent bulb produces 12 J of light for every 200 J of electrical input. A high-efficiency LED produces the same 12 J of light but only requires 40 J of input. Compare the efficiencies of both bulbs.
An industrial pump with an efficiency of 72% is used to lift 1,200 kg of oil to a height of 10.0 m. Calculate the total electrical energy input required for this task. (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)

A cyclist performs 600,000 J of mechanical work during a climb. If the human body is approximately 22% efficient at converting food energy into mechanical work, how much total food energy (in Joules) did the cyclist expend?
An electric motor rated at 2.0 hp ($1\text{ hp} = 746\text{ W}$) operates at 88% efficiency. Calculate the rate at which heat is generated (wasted power) by the motor during operation.

A pneumatic launcher uses 500 J of compressed air energy to accelerate a 0.40 kg projectile to a speed of 40 m/s. Determine the efficiency of the launcher in converting air energy into the kinetic energy of the projectile.

scoreMessages.70: Good work! Review how efficiency relates input and output energy.
scoreMessages.50: Keep practicing. Focus on $\text{Efficiency} = \text{Useful Output}/\text{Total Input}$.
scoreMessages.0: Let's review. Study how to calculate useful work and total input energy.
